page.title: 07The history of New Tredegar.
page.content: Until a few years ago New Tredegar and the Deri Valleys were mining communities.There used to be 5 collieries in the area Elliot's East, Elliot's West,White Rose coal level, Groes Faen and Oglivy.The last of these Elliots West closed in 1967. Upon Brithdir mountain there was a church called The Capel which was burnt down a few years ago.There is a cross to mark the place where it once stood.There is also a Roman road across the top of this mountain from Tirphil to Fochriw.There are 8 chapels and 1 church now in use. At Sunnybank Road Dr. McMillan had a doctor's surgery.When Dr. McMillan died a monument (A clock) was erected to his memory. The clock stands in Elliot Square Elliot Town.Lord Elliot owned most of the property in the district hence the name Elliot Town.
